alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Copper River Basin; Kodiak Island; Matanuska Valley; Northeast Prince William Sound; Southeast Prince William Sound; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 06 at 12:54PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...First Arctic air of the season remains on track for late this weekend... An area of low pressure currently over the Arctic north of eastern Russia continues to send a cold front eastward across much of the Bering Sea, southwest Mainland, and then Southcentral Alaska through Friday. At the same time, a system from the North Pacific moves northward Friday bringing moderate rain to most locations. While Arctic air looks to filter through the Alaska Range as rain is ongoing Saturday night through Sunday, the snow level is not likely to reach down to sea level. The most likely areas to transition to snow are Broad Pass (from Chulitna northward) and the higher elevations of the Copper River Basin (mainly from Paxson northward) with some accumulation. Strong gusty north and northwesterly winds are possible in favored gap locations along the northern coast of the Gulf of Alaska such as Resurrection Bay, Passage Canal, and Kamishak Gap. Many locations could experience the first sub-freezing temperatures of the season. There is higher forecast confidence in the arrival of the cold air mass, however variations in the depth of cold air and timing of arrival of the cold air has led to lower confidence in regards to any rain transitioning to snow. Stay tuned to further developments regarding this system at weather.gov/anchorage
